body: Which version/revision of glfw? It certainly doesn't happen to me with 3.0.4, with or without external monitor. Same OS X version and video card.
Not sure if relevant, but you should be calling `glfwTerminate()` after `glfwInit()`, before return. (And error check `glfwInit()`.)

I've built glfw 3.0.4 from source. You'll need build tools (can use Xcode command line tools) and cmake installed, then it's just:

``` bash
git clone https://github.com/glfw/glfw.git
cd glfw
git checkout 3.0.4
cmake .
make
```

There have been some changes to the monitor related code recently, so this may be a genuine glfw bug. If it still happens with 3.0.4, try with the latest commit, and if that doesn't work either, @elmindreda should look into it.

What monitor do you have?

Also try running `tests/glfwinfo` and `tests/modes`.

I'll be out for the weekend, so I won't be able to test until monday-ish. But I have some crappy ASUS monitor at home (the one that was causing the crash). However, I tried running it at work after upgrading it, and when plugged into an apple monitor everything worked fine. Stupid idea of me to test after changing TWO variables (updated to 3.0.4 AND different monitor). But yeah I'll get back to you guys after testing on monday. Thanks for the help!

Ok. Wow. I did some testing and figured it out. The error is only present when I'm mirroring displays on an external monitor, with the external monitor rotated @ 180 degrees. I can replicate this perfectly reliably. I have no idea if this bug then is an apple bug? Is there any other info that would be useful to get you?
Let me try to reproduce it. What do I need to do, exactly?

Hah, yep, repro'ed. With mirroring and external rotated by 180.

```
go version go1.2 darwin/amd64
panic: glfw.ErrorCallback: 65544: Cocoa: Failed to find NSScreen for CGDisplay 
```

It's probably a bug in GLFW that can be fixed. I would imagine Apple is returning some unexpected values for mirrored/180 case, and GLFW doesn't handle it properly. Hopefully @elmindreda can reproduce and fix it.
